definition: greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: Oh, I am not scared of anyone, I die for you.
sentences.chinese: 噢，我并不恐惧任何人，我可以为你贪生怕死。

sentences.english: Blade regiment several times, but nearly will also save himself falling.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋贪生怕死几次扑救，却险些也将本人堕入。

sentences.english: Zhaoyang will you afraid to die after all?
sentences.chinese: 终究昭阳会否贪生怕死？

definition: see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
